intro: Adicea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed adicea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Adicea longipes is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical environments.
